message.content:
cs.CR, cs.GT, cs.DC, cs.DS, cs.LG

The paper deals with the problem of exchanging a digital good for payment without trusted third parties, which is a fundamental problem for electronic commerce. This problem falls under the category of computer security (cs.CR) as it involves ensuring cheat-proof delivery and payment. The paper also analyzes the problem as an extensive-form game, which falls under the category of game theory (cs.GT). The use of blockchain-based smart contracts and cryptographic primitives suggests that the paper may also belong to the categories of distributed computing (cs.DC) and data structures and algorithms (cs.DS). Finally, the paper presents a protocol for cooperation and honest behavior, which may fall under the category of machine learning (cs.LG) as it involves learning and adapting to the behavior of the other party.
